summary: [Optum] Cleanup to fix issues due to incorrect Stride config
description:
Due to incorrect config in the Stride feature, members are in the following states that need cleanup:

# *Incorrectly* showing as completed target, but haven’t earned from the promotion
*Action needed:* Update target value of the user to reflect the manually computed value

# Correctly showing as completed target, but haven’t earned from the promotion
*Action needed:* Replay target completed event to ensure member earns from the promotion

# *Incorrectly* showing as not completed target
*Action needed:* Replay BEs to ensure member completes target and earns from the promotion



Sheet for clean up: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18aB9ok1I_cL2TGwedlay7WDDaFvU-LL_-pyrL-BkDB0/edit?gid=0#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18aB9ok1I_cL2TGwedlay7WDDaFvU-LL_-pyrL-BkDB0/edit?gid=0#gid=0|smart-link] 

Sheet contains all cases, cases that need clean up, which are ready to be picked, and the details of users, user_target_id, promotion_id etc

summary: Timezone issue analysis
description:
For date type extended fields in est time zone (machine time zone set in ushc) the final date that is getting saved in the db is incorrect.

like for example {{2025-02-05}} date gets converted {{2025-02-04}} because of data string conversion code block in DataAdapter



* *IST (Indian Standard Time)*
IST = UTC + 5:30
* *GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)*
GMT = UTC
* *EST (Eastern Standard Time)*
EST = UTC - 5:00
* *CST (Central Standard Time)*
CST = UTC - 6:00

as this essentially only impacts the timezones which are behind UTC it is only impacting uscrm & ushcrm.

we need a code fix which uses the org configuration to not assume the default timezone as UTC

summary: Add coupon redemption fields to Coupons redemption template
description:
We would need to make a minor enhancement to a template will get frequently used by US geo teams - the Coupon Redeem template. The template is based on the Coupon redeem api - [https://docs.capillarytech.com/reference/redeem-single-coupon|https://docs.capillarytech.com/reference/redeem-single-coupon|smart-link] . Recently, support for redemption custom fields have been added to this API. We would need to add this support the connect+ template under “custom fields” section in the mapping action.

This can be done via DIY template but since this is a commonly used template (or will be), we can add support natively.

summary: NWG - For Events and Cinema Booking, Pass Customer Email ID, Phone Number and Billing Address in Checkout.com Request Payment API - AST, Hub and App
description:
*Scope*

* For payment collection for event and cinema booking, hub, app, and AST call [checkout.com|http://checkout.com] requestPayment API - [https://api-reference.checkout.com/#operation/requestAPaymentOrPayout|https://api-reference.checkout.com/#operation/requestAPaymentOrPayout]
* Passing the below values in the API:
** Customer Identifiers
*** “email” (customer’s email)
*** “country_code” (customer’s phone number country code, if available)
*** “number” (customer’s phone number, if available)
** Customer’s billing address. *Note that we currently pass these values in shipping address; the same values could be passed in the billing address.*
*** "address_line1"
*** "address_line2"
*** "city"
*** "state"
*** "zip"
*** "country"
* This has to be implemented for payments initiated by customer on Hub and App
* This has to be implemented for payments initiated by agents via AST.

* correct data

summary: Erajaya Issue debugging &  data fix
description:
Related ticket : [https://capillarytech.atlassian.net/browse/CAP-142350|https://capillarytech.atlassian.net/browse/CAP-142350|smart-link] 
Things Done : 

* Debug the issue , result : found the multiple use=false as the core reason for the failing redemptions
* Work with frontend team (Anuroop) on verifying the reasoning 
* Raise hotswaps for the coupon configs where the multiple use was false and any_use was true and brand was expecting multiple redemptions
* Found all the vulnerable coupon configs and created tickets to brand CSMs to confirm on the redemption settings expectation

summary: GET//arya/api/v1/bi/translations/:language giving status 500 in bi node
description:
Grafana Logs Bi Node- [https://grafana.eucrm.cctools.capillarytech.com/tunnel/5f6d6a96c7f7c00007f726df/grafana/d/O81802cgLx3dUd57/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=2a97e172298dfaeda55748c6a2bb884a&var-app=bi-api-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742841000000&to=1742927399000|https://grafana.eucrm.cctools.capillarytech.com/tunnel/5f6d6a96c7f7c00007f726df/grafana/d/O81802cgLx3dUd57/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=2a97e172298dfaeda55748c6a2bb884a&var-app=bi-api-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742841000000&to=1742927399000]

Grafana Logs Arya-
[https://grafana.eucrm.cctools.capillarytech.com/tunnel/5f6d6a96c7f7c00007f726df/grafana/d/O81802cgLx3dUd57/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=2a97e172298dfaeda55748c6a2bb884a&var-app=arya-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742841000000&to=1742927399000|https://grafana.eucrm.cctools.capillarytech.com/tunnel/5f6d6a96c7f7c00007f726df/grafana/d/O81802cgLx3dUd57/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=2a97e172298dfaeda55748c6a2bb884a&var-app=arya-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742841000000&to=1742927399000]

A GET request was made to the /arya/api/v1/bi/translations/en-US API.
The API returned a 500 error (Internal Server Error) after a response time of ~1.3 seconds.The translations were retrieved successfully (status: 200), but the total time for processing was 661ms.
The BI API took ~1.3 seconds before failing with a 500 error.
This suggests the issue might not be in Arya itself but in how BI processed the response.

summary: [Action Required] Potential issue with nginx-ingress on your Amazon EKS cluster(s) [AWS Account: 313496281593] [US-EAST-1]
comments:
[{"author": "Harish Kumar", "timestamp": "2025-04-26T13:05:50.390+0530", "cleaned_body": "{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Original Author: Sreejith S
Posted on: 3/25/2025, 7:16:32 PM
{panel}

Please find the details below.Vulnerability:Ingress NGINX deploys an admission controller within its pod, designed to validate incoming ingress objects before they are deployed. By default, admission controllers are accessible over the network without authentication, making them a highly appealing attack vector. When the Ingress-NGINX admission controller processes an incoming ingress object, it constructs an NGINX configuration from it and then validates it using the NGINX binary. Vulnerability in this phase that allows injecting an arbitrary NGINX configuration remotely, by sending a malicious ingress object directly to the admission controller through the network.  During the configuration validation phase, the injected NGINX configuration causes the NGINX validator to execute code, allowing remote code execution (RCE) on the Ingress NGINX Controller’s pod. Affected Versions< v1.11.0v1.11.0 - 1.11.4v1.12.0Mitigation:Update to the latest version of Ingress NGINX Controller. This vulnerability is fixed in Ingress NGINX Controller version 1.12.1 and 1.11.5.Ensure the admission webhook endpoint is not exposed externally.If you can’t upgrade immediately, consider one of these mitigations:If you have installed ingress-nginx using Helm, reinstall with controller.admissionWebhooks.enabled=falseUnder the scope of  Capillary Infrastructure:The controller version that we are running is 1.3.1.By default admission webhook is disabled in all clusters.Even though temporary fix is in place we will in need upgrade the ingress controller version as a permanent fix. We will raise ticket to Facet's for the same.We have received the alert mail from AWS for Cap-cloudmanagement and professional services account. I have already informed the respective PoC's regarding the same. In capcloudmanagment, AWS reported this for a demo eks cluster for Facet's. For PSV, the cluster seems to be managed by NA devops team by the name sunoco-dev.Ref:         .          ======================================
/ccasiacrm

summary: AMJ Loyalty Regular track Dependency
Option to restrict Goodwill Points allocation alerts on Email/Mobile
description:
Hi Team,

Currently, we are sending out alerts on goodwill points allocation, and there seems to be no way to restrict it. Hence, if we set the template and subject to be empty, it triggers an empty email.

Hence, we have to make an option to restrict these alerts.

More Info at : [https://capillarytech.atlassian.net/browse/CAP-143670?focusedCommentId=1101640|https://capillarytech.atlassian.net/browse/CAP-143670?focusedCommentId=1101640|smart-link]

Reason:
There is one sql query "getOrgConfigValueByKey" where we are runnig sql query. This is return orgPrimaryIdentifierCode. Query is executed fine. 
We also cannot find the logs for cap-ui-utils for the response.
Action item 

* Added a log to find out what value is coming for now from that query. 
* Also modified the code to set parentCustomerModel to null otherwise

summary: A metric named clnt.reon-dbs-client.request_payload_bytes already exists error
description:
[+https://grafana.tools-a-crm-asiacrm.cc.capillarytech.com/tunnel/66538e0a0328160007c7ee95/grafana/d/K5U90JEmO76t4p9W/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=e3174edaabc1682d049f9bdd626b0312&var-app=bi-api-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742322600000&to=1742408999000+|https://grafana.tools-a-crm-asiacrm.cc.capillarytech.com/tunnel/66538e0a0328160007c7ee95/grafana/d/K5U90JEmO76t4p9W/loki-log-search?orgId=1&var-search=e3174edaabc1682d049f9bdd626b0312&var-app=bi-api-a&var-all_apps=.%2B&from=1742322600000&to=1742408999000]

Reason:
reon-dbs-client attempted to track a metric (clnt.reon-dbs-client.request_payload_bytes), which is likely used for monitoring request sizes.However, this metric is already registered. There were 2 thirft call. The first call registers the metric successfully and the second call tries to register it again, the second one will fail with the "already exists" error.

summary: Misconfigured Streaks
description:
In Optum Prod Parent (and Optum Parent UAT) orgs there are two streaks which are misconfigured. Eat potassium-rich foods_Streak_v8 (605/509), and Eat slowly_Streak_v8 (604, 508) have the target that they’re tracking mixed up. Currently Eat Slowly streak is tracking completion of Eat Potassium-Rich Foods milestone, and Eat Potassium-Rich Foods streak is tracking completion of Eat Slowly milestone. Due to concerns with client reporting, we are trying to do everything we can to not have to configure new streaks to replace these, and are hoping someone can swap the targets they’re targeting on the back end.
This change should be made in both orgs.
Please let me know what information you need.
